alert.note: Alert for Pemiscot (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 10:07PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Mississippi, southern Pemiscot, central Dyer and northeastern Lauderdale Counties through 1030 PM CDT... At 1007 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Miston to near Heloise to near Steele. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Dyersburg, Blytheville, Steele, Halls, Cooter, Bradleytown, Heloise, Unionville, Miston, Holland, Edith, Fowlkes, Bonicord, Jenkinsville, Poplar Grove, Parker, Nauvoo, Boothspoint, Nankipoo and Armorel. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
